pageProps.contentHtml:
construction, Lp spaces

Let {fn}n\set{f_n}_n{fn​}n​ be a sequence of real-valued Lebesgue measurable functions on R\RR and let fff be another such function. Assume that

  1. fn→ff_n \to ffn​→f, Lebesgue almost everywhere,
  2. ∫R∣x∣∣fn(x)∣ dx≤100\int_\R \abs{x} \abs{f_n\p{x}} \,\diff{x} \leq 100∫R​∣x∣∣fn​(x)∣dx≤100, for all nnn, and
  3. ∫R∣fn(x)∣2 dx≤100\int_\R \abs{f_n\p{x}}^2 \,\diff{x} \leq 100∫R​∣fn​(x)∣2dx≤100, for all nnn>

Prove that fn∈L1f_n \in L^1fn​∈L1 for all nnn, that f∈L1f \in L^1f∈L1, and that ∥fn−f∥L1→0\norm{f_n - f}_{L^1} \to 0∥fn​−f∥L1​→0. Also show that neither assumption (ii) nor assumption (iii) can be omitted while making these deductions.
Solution.

Let ggg be a Lebesgue measurable function on R\RR satisfying conditions (ii) and (iii). Then

∫R∣g(x)∣ dx=∫{∣x∣≤1}∣g(x)∣ dx+∫{∣x∣>1}∣g(x)∣ dx=∫{∣x∣≤1}∩{∣g(x)∣≥1}∣g(x)∣ dx+∫{∣x∣≤1}∩{∣g(x)∣<1}∣g(x)∣ dx+∫{∣x∣>1}∣g(x)∣ dx≤∫{∣x∣≤1}∩{∣g(x)∣≥1}∣g(x)∣2 dx+∫{∣x∣≤1} dx+∫{∣x∣>1}∣x∣∣g(x)∣ dx≤200+2<∞,\begin{aligned} \int_\R \abs{g\p{x}} \,\diff{x} &= \int_{\set{\abs{x} \leq 1}} \abs{g\p{x}} \,\diff{x} + \int_{\set{\abs{x} > 1}} \abs{g\p{x}} \,\diff{x} \\ &= \int_{\set{\abs{x} \leq 1} \cap \set{\abs{g\p{x}} \geq 1}} \abs{g\p{x}} \,\diff{x} + \int_{\set{\abs{x} \leq 1} \cap \set{\abs{g\p{x}} < 1}} \abs{g\p{x}} \,\diff{x} + \int_{\set{\abs{x} > 1}} \abs{g\p{x}} \,\diff{x} \\ &\leq \int_{\set{\abs{x} \leq 1} \cap \set{\abs{g\p{x}} \geq 1}} \abs{g\p{x}}^2 \,\diff{x} + \int_{\set{\abs{x} \leq 1}} \,\diff{x} + \int_{\set{\abs{x} > 1}} \abs{x} \abs{g\p{x}} \,\diff{x} \\ &\leq 200 + 2 \\ &< \infty, \end{aligned}∫R​∣g(x)∣dx​=∫{∣x∣≤1}​∣g(x)∣dx+∫{∣x∣>1}​∣g(x)∣dx=∫{∣x∣≤1}∩{∣g(x)∣≥1}​∣g(x)∣dx+∫{∣x∣≤1}∩{∣g(x)∣<1}​∣g(x)∣dx+∫{∣x∣>1}​∣g(x)∣dx≤∫{∣x∣≤1}∩{∣g(x)∣≥1}​∣g(x)∣2dx+∫{∣x∣≤1}​dx+∫{∣x∣>1}​∣x∣∣g(x)∣dx≤200+2<∞,​

so g∈L1g \in L^1g∈L1. Hence, fn∈L1f_n \in L^1fn​∈L1 for all nnn. By Fatou's lemma, we also see that

∫R∣x∣∣f(x)∣ dx≤lim inf⁡n→∞∫R∣x∣∣fn(x)∣ dx≤100∫R∣f(x)∣2 dx≤lim inf⁡n→∞∫R∣fn(x)∣2 dx≤100,\begin{gathered} \int_\R \abs{x} \abs{f\p{x}} \,\diff{x} \leq \liminf_{n\to\infty} \int_\R \abs{x} \abs{f_n\p{x}} \,\diff{x} \leq 100 \\ \int_\R \abs{f\p{x}}^2 \,\diff{x} \leq \liminf_{n\to\infty} \int_\R \abs{f_n\p{x}}^2 \,\diff{x} \leq 100, \end{gathered}∫R​∣x∣∣f(x)∣dx≤n→∞liminf​∫R​∣x∣∣fn​(x)∣dx≤100∫R​∣f(x)∣2dx≤n→∞liminf​∫R​∣fn​(x)∣2dx≤100,​

so fff satisfies the same conditions, i.e., f∈L1f \in L^1f∈L1 as well. To prove L1L^1L1 convergence, fix ε>0\epsilon > 0ε>0. Then observe that

∫{∣x∣≥R}∣fn(x)∣ dx≤∫{∣x∣≥R}∣x∣∣fn(x)∣∣x∣ dx≤100R,\int_{\set{\abs{x} \geq R}} \abs{f_n\p{x}} \,\diff{x} \leq \int_{\set{\abs{x} \geq R}} \frac{\abs{x}\abs{f_n\p{x}}}{\abs{x}} \,\diff{x} \leq \frac{100}{R},∫{∣x∣≥R}​∣fn​(x)∣dx≤∫{∣x∣≥R}​∣x∣∣x∣∣fn​(x)∣​dx≤R100​,

and this inequality is true with fnf_nfn​ replaced with fff as well. Thus, we may pick R>0R > 0R>0 large enough so that ∫{∣x∣≥R}∣fn(x)∣ dx<ε\int_{\set{\abs{x} \geq R}} \abs{f_n\p{x}} \,\diff{x} < \epsilon∫{∣x∣≥R}​∣fn​(x)∣dx<ε and ∫{∣x∣≥R}∣f(x)∣ dx<ε\int_{\set{\abs{x} \geq R}} \abs{f\p{x}} \,\diff{x} < \epsilon∫{∣x∣≥R}​∣f(x)∣dx<ε. On the finite measure set B(0,R)B\p{0, R}B(0,R), we may apply Egorov's theorem, since fn→ff_n \to ffn​→f almost everywhere. Hence, we get E⊆B(0,R)E \subseteq B\p{0, R}E⊆B(0,R) such that fn→ff_n \to ffn​→f uniformly on B(0,R)∖EB\p{0, R} \setminus EB(0,R)∖E and with m(E)<εm\p{E} < \epsilonm(E)<ε. Thus, if nnn is large enough, then ∣fn−f∣<ε2R\abs{f_n - f} < \frac{\epsilon}{2R}∣fn​−f∣<2Rε​ on B(0,R)∖EB\p{0, R} \setminus EB(0,R)∖E, and so

∫R∣fn−f∣ dx≤∫B(0,R)∣fn−f∣ dx+∫{∣x∣≥R}∣fn∣ dx+∫{∣x∣≥R}∣f∣ dx≤∫E∣fn−f∣ dx+∫B(0,R)∖E∣fn−f∣ dx+2ε≤∥fn−f∥L2m(E)1/2+3ε≤ε1/2(∥fn∥L2+∥f∥L2)+3ε≤20ε1/2+3ε,\begin{aligned} \int_\R \abs{f_n - f} \,\diff{x} &\leq \int_{B\p{0,R}} \abs{f_n - f} \,\diff{x} + \int_{\set{\abs{x} \geq R}} \abs{f_n} \,\diff{x} + \int_{\set{\abs{x} \geq R}} \abs{f} \,\diff{x} \\ &\leq \int_E \abs{f_n - f} \,\diff{x} + \int_{B\p{0,R} \setminus E} \abs{f_n - f} \,\diff{x} + 2\epsilon \\ &\leq \norm{f_n - f}_{L^2} m\p{E}^{1/2} + 3\epsilon \\ &\leq \epsilon^{1/2}\p{\norm{f_n}_{L^2} + \norm{f}_{L^2}} + 3\epsilon \\ &\leq 20\epsilon^{1/2} + 3\epsilon, \end{aligned}∫R​∣fn​−f∣dx​≤∫B(0,R)​∣fn​−f∣dx+∫{∣x∣≥R}​∣fn​∣dx+∫{∣x∣≥R}​∣f∣dx≤∫E​∣fn​−f∣dx+∫B(0,R)∖E​∣fn​−f∣dx+2ε≤∥fn​−f∥L2​m(E)1/2+3ε≤ε1/2(∥fn​∥L2​+∥f∥L2​)+3ε≤20ε1/2+3ε,​

so ∥fn−f∥L1→0\norm{f_n - f}_{L^1} \to 0∥fn​−f∥L1​→0.

To see that (2) is necessary, consider fn(x)=f(x)=∣x∣−1χB(0,1)f_n\p{x} = f\p{x} = \abs{x}^{-1} \chi_{B\p{0,1}}fn​(x)=f(x)=∣x∣−1χB(0,1)​. Then these satisfy (1) trivially and satisfy (2) since ∣x∣∣fn(x)∣=χB(0,1)\abs{x}\abs{f_n\p{x}} = \chi_{B\p{0,1}}∣x∣∣fn​(x)∣=χB(0,1)​, which certainly has integral bounded by 100100100. Moreover, it does not satisfy (3) since fn∉L2f_n \notin L^2fn​∈/L2. However, fn∉L1f_n \notin L^1fn​∈/L1, since ∣x∣−1\abs{x}^{-1}∣x∣−1 is not integrable near the origin, so the conclusion fails.

Similarly, to see that (3) is necessary, let fn(x)=f(x)=∣x∣−1χ{∣x∣≥1}f_n\p{x} = f\p{x} = \abs{x}^{-1} \chi_{\set{\abs{x} \geq 1}}fn​(x)=f(x)=∣x∣−1χ{∣x∣≥1}​. This it's clear that (1) and (3) are satisfied, but (2) is not satisfied since ∣x∣∣fn(x)∣=χ{∣x∣≥1}\abs{x}\abs{f_n\p{x}} = \chi_{\set{\abs{x} \geq 1}}∣x∣∣fn​(x)∣=χ{∣x∣≥1}​, which has infinite mass. As before, fn∉L1f_n \notin L^1fn​∈/L1, so the conclusion fails.
